org.mcm.sws.pddl
Class Formula

java.lang.Object
  org.mcm.sws.pddl.Formula
Direct Known Subclasses:
Comparison, Conjunction, Disjunction, Implication, Literal, NumericFormula, QuantifiedFormula, WhenFormula
public abstract class Formula
extends java.lang.Object

The abstract superclass of all Formula objects.

Author:
Joachim Peer

abstract  Formula cloneAndSubstitute(java.util.Map bindings)
          replicate the formula (clone it and all sub-objects) and substitute the variables by values given in the map.
abstract  java.util.List expandToFacts()
          take a formula and try to extract factual value from it. we assume that all variables are bound to values
 ForallFormula findForallFormula(Variable var)
          check if the formula contains a universal quantified formula, and if so return it. when materializing effects of operations after successful service interaction, if the effect contains quantified formulas.

Method Detail

getFormulaeWith

public abstract java.util.List getFormulaeWith(java.lang.String param)
get the atoms contained in the formula that contain the term "param&qout;

cloneAndSubstitute

public abstract Formula cloneAndSubstitute(java.util.Map bindings)
replicate the formula (clone it and all sub-objects) and substitute the variables by values given in the map. this method is used when materializing effects of operations after successful service interaction.

expandToFacts

public abstract java.util.List expandToFacts()
take a formula and try to extract factual value from it. we assume that all variables are bound to values

negate

public abstract Formula negate()
get the negation of the formula

getDNF

public Formula getDNF()
get disjunctive normal formula

toString

public java.lang.String toString()

getPDDL

public abstract java.lang.String getPDDL()
get the PDDL representation of the formula

getProlog

public java.lang.String getProlog(java.lang.String queryHead)

findForallFormula

public ForallFormula findForallFormula(Variable var)
check if the formula contains a universal quantified formula, and if so return it. when materializing effects of operations after successful service interaction, if the effect contains quantified formulas. each forall formula may yield several atomic formulae to be instantiated. (for instance lists of catalog items, etc.)
